news_header: The Houthis in Yemen have recently kidnapped UN staff and released prisoners, indicating a complex negotiation strategy amidst ongoing conflict.
news_text: The Houthi militia in Yemen has shown a zigzag approach in their recent actions, including the kidnapping of 7 UN employees and the release of a merchant ship's crew and 153 prisoners of war. These moves are seen as part of their negotiation strategy amidst a backdrop of renewed terrorist designations by the US. The UN has suspended aid in Houthi-controlled areas due to the kidnappings, exacerbating the humanitarian crisis affecting half of Yemen's population.
